Description: Small stone palette, made of a whitish granite. It has an oval outer shape and a slightly rounded base and does not stand well. The interior depression is shallowly shaped and well smoothed while the outer surface is roughly finished. In the depression remains of red pigment (ochre?). The depression has a depth of 1.5cm.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), D14.8A, later floor
Bibliographic references: Spencer 1997 / Amara West I, The Architectural Report (p. 159)
